contextId.information: "by the means of lawless men," "by the authority of lawless men," or "by using lawless men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: by the hand of lawless men

contextId.information: To be at someone's "right hand" often means to be in a position to help and sustain. AT: "right beside me" or "with me to help me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: beside my right hand

contextId.information: People consider the "heart" the center of emotions and the "tongue" voices those emotions. AT: "I was glad and rejoiced" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: my heart was glad and my tongue rejoiced

contextId.information: Here the word "Fear" refers to deep respect and awe for God. The word "soul" refers to the entire person. AT: "Each person felt a deep respect and awe for God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Fear came upon every soul

contextId.information: This is a reference to the Sanhedrin, the Jewish ruling court, which consisted of these three groups of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: their rulers, elders and scribes

contextId.information: Here the phrase "the feet" refers to the men. AT: "the men who have buried your husband" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: the feet of the men who buried your husband

contextId.information: Here the word "hands" refers to the apostles. AT: "through the apostles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: through the hands of the apostles

contextId.information: "made by people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: made with hands

contextId.information: Here "villages" refers to the people in them. AT: "to the people in many Samaritan villages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: to many villages of the Samaritans

contextId.information: This refers to the leaders of the Jews. AT: "the Jewish leaders" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: the Jews

contextId.information: The person speaking is not specified. The "voice" was probably God, although it could possibly have been an angel from God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: a voice spoke to him

contextId.information: The person speaking is not specified. The "voice" was probably God, although it could possibly have been an angel from God. See how you translated "a voice" in [[:en:bible:notes:act:10:13|10:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I heard a voice

contextId.information: The "law and the prophets" refer to parts of the Jewish scriptures which were read. AT: "After someone read from the books of the law and the writings of the prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: After the reading of the law and the prophets

contextId.information: Here "Jews" represents Jewish leaders. AT: "the Jewish leaders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: the Jews

contextId.information: Here "souls" refers to the disciples. This emphasizes their inner thoughts and beliefs. AT: "Paul and Barnabas urged the believers to continue to believe the message about Jesus" or "Paul and Barnabas urged the believers to continue to grow strong in their relationship with Jesus (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: They kept strengthening the souls of the disciples

contextId.information: Here "souls" refers to the people. AT: "have taught things that have troubled you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: disturbed you with teachings that upset your souls

contextId.information: Here "spirit" stands for Paul himself. This can be stated in active form. AT: "he became upset because he saw that there were idols everywhere in the city" or "seeing the idols everywhere in the city upset him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his spirit was provoked within him as he saw the city full of idols

contextId.information: Here "hands" stands for Paul's whole person. AT: "God was causing Paul to do miracles" or "God was doing miracles through Paul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: God was doing mighty deeds by the hands of Paul

contextId.information: Here the word "hands" can refer to the whole person. AT: He is saying that there are no gods that are made with the hands of people" or "He is saying that the idols that people make are not real gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: He is saying that there are no gods that are made with hands

contextId.information: This means only some of the Jews. AT: "by some of the Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: by the Jews

contextId.information: Bread was a common food during meals. Here "break bread" probably means they shared a meal with more kinds of food than just bread. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: broke bread

contextId.information: This does not mean every Jew. This lets us know who plotted.  AT: "of some of the Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: of the Jews

contextId.information: The word "hands" here represents the entire person. AT: "I worked to earn money and pay for my own expenses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: these hands served my own needs

contextId.information: Here "foot" stands for the whole person. AT: "that he should not go to Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: that he should not set foot in Jerusalem

contextId.information: They did not go into the temple itself where only the high priest was allowed to enter. They entered the temple courtyard. AT: "went into the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: went into the temple

contextId.information: Paul was not in the temple itself. He was in the temple courtyard. AT: "in the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: in the temple

contextId.information: Here "voice" stands for the person speaking. AT: "I heard someone say to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: heard a voice say to me

contextId.information: Here "voice" stands for the person speaking. AT: "they did not understand what the one who spoke to me was saying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: they did not understand the voice of him who spoke to me

contextId.information: Here "hands" stands for those leading Paul. This can be stated in active form. AT: "those with me guided me into Damascus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and being led by the hands of those who were with me, I came into Damascus

contextId.information: Both "voice" and "mouth" refer to the one speaking. AT: "to hear him speak directly to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: to hear the voice coming from his own mouth

contextId.information: Here "Jews" means "some of the Jews." This can be stated in active form. AT: "Some of the Jews arrested this man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This man was arrested by the Jews

contextId.information: This refers to the Jewish leaders who were there at Paul's trial. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: The Jews

contextId.information: Here "the Jews" means the Jewish leaders. AT: "wanted to please the Jewish leaders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: wanted to gain the favor of the Jews

contextId.information: This does not mean all the Jews. AT: "that the leaders of the Jews" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: that the Jews

contextId.information: This does not mean all of the Jews. AT: "the Jewish leaders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: the Jews
